channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The markets are behaving as if Europe has pulled the wool over Trump’s eyes
item.description: Investors are trading as if one of two conditions will turn out to be true: That the deal is composed of stuff that was going to happen anyway, or tha...

item.title: Meet the 40-something self-made ‘everyday millionaires’ who say they still don’t feel rich
item.description: Their first salaries were in the $30,000 range, they were children of immigrants, some grew up using food stamps. They're part of "the new mass-afflue...

item.title: Wesley LePatner, a 44-year-old Blackstone executive who oversaw its $53 billion real-estate investment fund, was killed in Manhattan’s mass shooting
item.description: LePatner one of four victims of Monday's mass shooting in New York City.

item.title: Even AI tools like ChatGPT think your employees should be making more money
item.description: Payscale found a growing gap between employer and employee salary expectations, and GenAI tools are contributing to a new norm.
